result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle J. Orlowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs and DNA surcharges.   If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross. (Bond applied - paid).
Comply with same conditions as stated in 16CF23.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: (Concurrent, if revoked at the same time with 16CF23) or (Consecutive, if not revoked with 16CF23).

miscConds.notes: Comply with same conditions as stated in Count 1 and 16CF23.

records.addlTxt:
10:40 a.m. Defendant Kyle J. Orlowski in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 15CF482, 15CT307, 15CT313, 16CF23, 15TR2948, and to be dismissed and read in 16CF53, 16CM24, 16CM25, 15TR2947, 15TR3411, 15TR3412, 15TR3442, 15TR3443, 15TR3444. (16CF23 count 6 was amended to 5)
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF482 Count 1: No Contest
15CF482 Count 4: No Contest
15CT307: No Contest
15CT313: No Contest
16CF23 Count 1: No Contest
16CF23 Count 5: No Contest
15TR2948: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  15CF482 Count 1, 15CF482 Count 4, 15CT307-2nd, 15CT313-3rd, 16CF23 Count 1, 16CF23 Count 5, 15TR2948.
Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Dismissed and read in 15CF482 Count 2, & 3, 16CF23 Count 2, 3, & 4, 16CF53, 16CM24, 16CM25, 15TR2947, 15TR3411, 15TR3412, 15TR3442, 15TR3443, and 15TR3444.
ADA Cousins states this is a joint recommendation. 
Atty Sheets concurs. 
Defendant makes statements to the court.

BY THE COURT:***PROBATION****
15CF482 Count 1: 
I/S Sentence 1 yr Jail, concurrent - stayed 
24 mo Probation, concurrent 
Comply with same conditions as stated in in 16CF23.
Pay costs & DNA surcharges.

15CF482 Count 4: I/S Sentence 6 mo Jail, concurrent--if revoke at the same time; otherwise, it would be consecutive - stayed
12 months probation, concurrent
Conditions:
Comply with same conditions as stated in 16CF23 and Count 1.
Pay costs and DNA surcharges.

16CF23 Count 1:
I/S Sentence 1 yr Jail - stayed
24 months probation
Conditions:
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.  
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.  
Get GED & Driver's License.
Comply with any other assessments and/or counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent.
Submit DNA sample, if didn't do so already.
Pay costs & DNA sucharges. 
-------
16CF23 Count 5: Straight Jail sentence
60 days jail, 1/2 in jail and balance on electronic monitor, with huber, Report today for start date. To be served within 60 days.
Jail credit to be stipulated and submit to the court at a later date.
Pay costs & DNA surcharges. Pay w/in 60 days or set up payment plan.

15CT307 Op w/o Valid 2nd: Pay costs w/in 60 days or set up payment plan.
15CT313 Op w/o Valid 3rd: Pay costs w/in 60 days or set up payment plan.
15TR2948 Seatbelt: $10.00 fine. Pay w/in 60 days or set up payment plan.
Plea hearing on May 11, 2016 at 10:30 am.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

BY THE COURT:
NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.
Bond and conditions of bond continued

Defendant Kyle J. Orlowski in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CF482 and 16CF23 and additional cases tracking with are 16CM24, 16CM25, 15CT307, 15CT313, 15TR3411 and 15TR3412.

4:01 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
Court dates and initials the addition of the date.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Kyle J. Orlowski in court with attorney Eric Sheets. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Cash bond $300.00
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Comply with terms of any existing bond.

1:48 p.m. case is called.
ADA Elizabeth Constable appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Constable states facts for anticipated charges of possession of THC, bail jumping, possession of parapharnalia, possession of Adderall.  
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a cash bond - $300.00  with conditions as stated.    

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  January 4, 2016  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2

BTC:
Cash bond $300.00
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Comply with terms with any existing bond.

1:56 p.m. case is concluded
